metadata.title: CVE-2017-11695 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the alloc_segs function in lib/dbm/src/hash.c in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) allows context-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact using a crafted cert8.db file.

notes.note: mdeslaur> Upstream NSS will not be fixing this issue. this is an issue in libnssdbm. NSS 3.35 made SQLite the default datastore. NSS 3.49 stopped building the legacy datastore.

criterions.comment: nss package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1').
